definition: with familiarity you learn the trick (idiom); practice makes perfect
cooked (of food)/ripe (of fruit)/mature (of seeds)/familiar/skilled/done/also pr. [shou2]
surname Neng
can/to be able to/might possibly/ability/(physics) energy
to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student
opportunely/coincidentally/as it happens/skillful/timely

sentences.english: Public speaking is like anything else: the more you do it, the better you'll become.
sentences.chinese: 公众演讲就像其他任何事一样，需要熟能生巧。

sentences.english: B: What you mean is that practice makes perfect.
sentences.chinese: 你的意思是说熟能生巧。

sentences.english: We all believe that"practice makes perfect.
We learned by actual experience that practice makes perfect.
sentences.chinese: 我们从实际经验中认识到熟能生巧。

sentences.english: Good seed spitting takes practice and motivation.
sentences.chinese: 吐籽这活儿，熟能生巧，且需要动力。

sentences.english: My mother smiled and said practice made perfect.
You get better at this game through practice;
sentences.chinese: 玩这场游戏，多多练习，熟能生巧巧。

sentences.english: Active listening is something that takes time to master, but practice makes perfect.
sentences.chinese: 掌握积极倾听的技能得花功夫练习，但熟能生巧。

sentences.english: As the saying goes, "practice makes perfect".
Note that this technique can take a while to perfect, but practice makes perfect.
sentences.chinese: 这个技巧需要练习，熟能生巧。

sentences.english: Finally no matter which memory technique you use, practice makes perfect.
sentences.chinese: 不管最终你使用的是何种技巧，记住熟能生巧。

sentences.english: and just constant practice makes perfect, right?
sentences.chinese: 还有持续练习才能熟能生巧，对吗？

definition: practiced/proficient/skilled/skillful
effort will undoubtedly lead to success (idiom)
basic skills/fundamentals
to comprehend (new things) by analogy
there is nothing the determined person can't accomplish (idiom)/persistence will overcome
pinyin: shi4 shang4 wu2 nan2 shi4 , zhi3 pa4 you3 xin1 ren2
related.word: 世上无难事，只怕有心人

definition: to study diligently/to train assiduously
habit becomes nature (idiom); get used to something and it seems inevitable/second nature
grasp this fundamental point and all the rest will follow (idiom)
to practice/exercise/drill/practice/CL:個|个[ge4]
lit. sharpening the axe won't make the wood-splitting take longer (idiom)/fig. time invested in preparations is not lost/a beard well lathered is half shaved
pinyin: mo2 dao1 bu4 wu4 kan3 chai2 gong1

definition: self-taught/to learn without a teacher (idiom)
unfamiliar at first, but well accustomed soon enough (idiom)
pinyin: yi1 hui2 sheng1 er4 hui2 shu2

definition: it's always good to have more skills (idiom)
the palest ink is better than the best memory (idiom)
pinyin: hao3 ji4 xing4 bu4 ru2 lan4 bi3 tou2

definition: If you work at it hard enough, you can grind an iron bar into a needle./cf idiom 磨杵成針|磨杵成针, to grind an iron bar down to a fine needle (idiom); fig. to persevere in a difficult task/to study diligently
pinyin: zhi3 yao4 gong1 fu5 shen1 , tie3 chu3 mo2 cheng2 zhen1
related.word: 只要功夫深，铁杵磨成针

definition: every beginning is difficult (idiom)/getting started is always the hardest part
